text: I think it could be a good idea to have something like the HubSpot Code Gallery, but for Campaigns, Sequences, essentially a “Best Practice Gallery for HubSpot Agencies”
Also for Sales and Service Hub Topics
I think actually that they have stuff like that somewhere. I swear I’ve seen a resource gallery kinda like that
but not necessarily where others can submit stuff

yes there are a ton of resources, but they are also sometimes “theoretical” not  “battled hardned, tried and tested, real examples..” at least i did not find that. Compared to code, there are a lot of “Codepens” but not complete tutorials from start to finish how to code x or y.

btw i am not looking for a tutorial on how to setup a campaign or anything. More like if you come from University you think you can code…in the first week a lot of senior devs show you, why you are far away from it.
this issue has been successfully resolved yesterday :slightly_smiling_face:
on the other hand, people might be worried that they share trade secrets and stuff that builds their USP / competitive Advantage
the Design Manager reeeeeeally needs a warning when multiple people are editing the same file

I can tell you that to a degree, that does actually happen.

I have a couple specific techniques we use at my company that I’ve been explicitly told I can’t talk about to other devs for that reason. (If they are clients though and their project calls for them that’s different)

That said that is not the case for the majority of things.
